Owner.Name: LocVer
Owner.Desc: Use these settings to control how Localization Verification (LocVer) is handled.

Group.Name: Rules
Group.Desc: Settings to control which localization rules (LocVer rules) should be processed.

Setting.Name: Custom Rule Assemblies
Setting.Desc: List of assemblies containing custom rules for LocVer.

Group.Name: NameSpaces
Group.Desc: Settings to control which namespaces should be processed. A namespace precedes the rule name, e.g. for the rule {xsd:integer}, 'xsd' is the namespace.

Setting.Name: Include
Setting.Desc: Only process rules that exist in the namespaces that are in this list.

Setting.Name: Exclude
Setting.Desc: Don't process any rules that exist in the namespaces that are in this list.

Setting.Name: Default NameSpace
Setting.Desc: Any rule specified without a namespace, e.g. {Locked}, is in this namespace.

Setting.Name: { FontFace }
Setting.Desc: Rule { FontFace } verifies the font face.

Setting.Name: { FontFamily }
Setting.Desc: Rule { FontFamily } verifies the font family.

Setting.Name: { FontSize }
Setting.Desc: Rule { FontSize } verifies the font size.

Setting.Name: { PSAccountName }
Setting.Desc: Rule { PSAccountName } verifies the accountname for pseudo.

Setting.Name: { Adaptation }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Adaptation = <(sub)string> } verifies that a <(sub)string> is translated according to translation found in a map file.

Setting.Name: { AllGlobalRules }
Setting.Desc: Rule { AllGlobalRules } forces all global rules to be run, irrespective of any other settings for LocVer.

Setting.Name: { AllRules }
Setting.Desc: Rule { AllRules } forces all rules for the current item to be run, irrespective of any other settings for LocVer.

Setting.Name: { Comment }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Comment = <text> } issues the <text> to the output.

Setting.Name: { DataType }
Setting.Desc: Rule { DataType = <type>,[<facet>,...] } verifies that the translation is of a specified data type and follows all supplied constraints (or facets).

Setting.Name: { Dependency }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Dependency = <type>,[<resourceId>,...] } verifies that the translation matches another item.

Setting.Name: { Duplicate }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Duplicate = <type>,[<resourceId>,...] } verifies that the translation matches another item.

Setting.Name: { EscapeChars }
Setting.Desc: Rule { EscapeChars = <x=yy>,... } forces specified characters (x) to be escaped in the string using specified escape sequences (yy).

Setting.Name: { EscapePlaceholderChars }
Setting.Desc: Rule { EscapePlaceholderChars = <x=yy>,... } forces specified characters (x) to be escaped in the string using specified escape sequences (yy). Does not apply to any part of the string that is covered by {Placeholder}, {NumberedPlaceholder} or {FixedPlaceholder} rules.

Setting.Name: { FileName }
Setting.Desc: Rule { FileName = SFNLock|SFNLocalizable/LFNLock|LFNLocalizable } verifies that a string is a correct file name.

Setting.Name: { FixedPlaceHolder }
Setting.Desc: Rule { FixedPlaceholder = <plc1>,<plc2>,... } verifies that the translation contains the same number of specified placeholders (<plc1>,...) as the source and that they are in the same order.

Setting.Name: { Formatting }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Formatting = parameters } verifies that a string uses the correct formatting.

Setting.Name: { Hotkey }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Hotkey } verifies that a string contains a hotkey.

Setting.Name: { HTMLHotkey }
Setting.Desc: Rule { HTMLHotkey = <itemid> } verifies that an accesskey item matches the hotkey in the master item (<itemid>).

Setting.Name: { InvalidChars }
Setting.Desc: Rule { InvalidChars = <chars>,...} specifies that a set of characters (<chars>) cannot be used in the string.

Setting.Name: { InvalidStrings }
Setting.Desc: Rule { InvalidStrings = <string1>,<string2>... } verifies that the translation is not one of the strings (<string1>...) specified.

Setting.Name: { Locked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Locked } reverts the translation to source and sets 'User Src Lock'.

Setting.Name: { Map }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Map = <(sub)string> } verifies that a <(sub)string> is translated according to translation found in a map file.

Setting.Name: { MaxLength }
Setting.Desc: Rule { MaxLength = <X>,<namespace> } verifies that the translation is not longer than <X> characters. If a <namespace> is specified, the rule verifies that the total length of the <namespace> is not longer than X. (Works Cross-EDBs).

Setting.Name: { Menu }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Menu = <namespace> } verifies that there are no duplicate hotkeys within the <namespace>.

Setting.Name: { MinLength }
Setting.Desc: Rule { MinLength = <X>} verifies that the translation is at least <X> characters long.

Setting.Name: { NoAutoRules }
Setting.Desc: Rule { NoAutoRules } stops automatically generated rules (specified in 'Zero-Effort Commenting Settings') on the current item.

Setting.Name: { NoGlobalRules }
Setting.Desc: Rule { NoGlobalRules } skips any global rules (specified in 'Global Rules' setting) for the current item.

Setting.Name: { NoLocRules }
Setting.Desc: Rule { NoLocRules } stops automatically generated restrictions on the item.

Setting.Name: { NoRules }
Setting.Desc: Rule { NoRules } suppresses all output for the current item, irrespective of any other settings for LocVer.

Setting.Name: { NumberedPlaceHolder }
Setting.Desc: Rule { NumberedPlaceholder = <plc1>,<plc2>,... } verifies that the translation contains the same placeholders (<plc1>,...) as the source.

Setting.Name: { PlaceHolder }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Placeholder = <plc1>,<plc2>,... } verifies that the translation contains the same number of specified placeholders (<plc1>,...) as the source.

Setting.Name: { RegEx }
Setting.Desc: Rule { RegEx = <expr>,[<expr>] } verifies that the translation matches the specified regular expression.

Setting.Name: { RegExe }
Setting.Desc: Deprecated: Rule { RegExe = <expr> } verifies that the translation matches the specified regular expression.

Setting.Name: { RevertBinary }
Setting.Desc: Deprecated: Rule { RevertBinary } reverts the binary translation to source.

Setting.Name: { Split }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Split = <value>,... } splits a string according to the parameter(s) supplied.

Setting.Name: { StrBegins }
Setting.Desc: Rule { StrBegins = <value> } ensures that a string begins with a certain sub string (value).

Setting.Name: { StrContains }
Setting.Desc: Rule { StrContains = <value>,... } ensures that a string contains a certain sub string (value).

Setting.Name: { StrEnds }
Setting.Desc: Rule { StrEnds = <value> } ensures that a string ends with a certain sub string (value).

Setting.Name: { StringCategory }
Setting.Desc: Rule { StringCategory = <category> } sets the category of the string to specified value (<category>).

Setting.Name: { StringContains }
Setting.Desc: Rule { StringContains = <tla/lcid> } verifies that the translation contains the LCID or TLA of the current target culture.

Setting.Name: { SubString }
Setting.Desc: Rule { SubString = <value>,... } allows only part of a string (<value>) to be localized.

Setting.Name: { TabOrder }
Setting.Desc: Rule { TabOrder } is used to maintain TabOrder information per language.

Setting.Name: { TransLocked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { TransLocked } sets 'User Trans Lock' if localization status is set to Localized.

Setting.Name: { Trx }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Trx } forces the translation to be different than the source.

Setting.Name: { ValidChars }
Setting.Desc: Rule { ValidChars = <chars>,... } specifies that only a set of characters (<chars>) can be used in the string.

Setting.Name: { ValidStrings }
Setting.Desc: Rule { ValidStrings = <string1>,<string2>,... } verifies that only the strings (<string1>,...) specified are used as translations.

Setting.Name: { ValidWordSeparators }
Setting.Desc: Rule { ValidWordSeparators = <wordsep>} verifies that the only word separators used in the translation are those specified in <wordsep>.

Setting.Name: { Words }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Words = <X> } verifies that the Translation contains <X> number of words.

Setting.Name: { UniqueInNameSpace }
Setting.Desc: Rule { UniqueInNameSpace = <namespace> } verifies that the translation is unique within the <namespace>.

Setting.Name: { __VerCodePage }
Setting.Desc: Rule { __VerCodePage = codepage } verifies that the translation only contains characters valid on the specified codepage.

Group.Name: Centum Rules
Group.Desc: Settings for centum specific rules.

Setting.Name: { Centum:BinLocked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Centum:BinLocked } ensures that the binary translation is the same as the source language (Centum specific, behaves like {Binary:Locked} ).

Setting.Name: { Centum:BinTransLocked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Centum:BinTransLocked } ensures that the binary translation is not changed (Centum specific, behaves like {Binary:TransLocked} ).

Setting.Name: { Centum:Locked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Centum:Locked } ensures that the translation is the same as the source language (Centum specific, behaves like {Locked} ).

Setting.Name: { Centum:TransLocked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Centum:TransLocked } ensures that the translation is not changed (Centum specific, behaves like {TransLocked} ).

Group.Name: Binary Rules
Group.Desc: Settings for rules that affect the binary value of an item.

Setting.Name: { Binary:Locked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Binary:Locked } ensures that the binary translation is the same as the source language.

Setting.Name: { Binary:TransLocked }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Binary:TransLocked } ensures that the binary translation is not changed.

Setting.Name: { Binary:Trx }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Binary:Trx } ensures that the binary translation is different from the source.

Group.Name: Logging Rules
Group.Desc: Settings for rules that affect the messages issued for an item.

Setting.Name: { Log:Error }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Log:Error } sets the severity of messages for the item to 'Error'.

Setting.Name: { Log:HighPriority }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Log:HighPriority = <priorityString> } specifies that messages reported on the item has high priority and any error messages are prepended with the text defined by <priorityString>.

Setting.Name: { Log:Ignore }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Log:Ignore } suppresses messages for the item.

Setting.Name: { Log:Info }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Log:Info } sets the severity of messages for the item to 'Info'.

Setting.Name: { Log:Warning }
Setting.Desc: Rule { Log:Warning } sets the severity of messages for the item to 'Warning'.

Setting.Name: Global Rules
Setting.Desc: Specifies rules that will be evaluated against every item that LocVer runs on.

Setting.Name: Keywords to ignore
Setting.Desc: All keywords in this list will be ignored. Example: If the list contains 'MyRule' and 'Locked', the rules '{MyRule}' and '{Locked}' will be ignored.

Setting.Name: Invalid characters in translation
Setting.Desc: Check translations for invalid characters on the target language codepage.

Setting.Name: Default parameters behave as LocVer 4.6
Setting.Desc: Use literal (false) or regular expression (true) parameters as default for rules {FixedPlaceholder}, {NumberedPlaceholder}, {Split}, {StrBegins}, {StrContains} and {StrEnds}

Group.Name: Messages
Group.Desc: Settings for messages reported by LocVer.

Setting.Name: Report Unknown Rules
Setting.Desc: Issue messages when LocVer encounters unknown rules.

Setting.Name: Report Syntax Errors
Setting.Desc: Issue messages when LocVer encounters errors in the syntax of instructions.

Setting.Name: Report Source Messages
Setting.Desc: Issue messages when LocVer encounters errors on the source item.

Setting.Name: Only High Priority As Errors
Setting.Desc: Only issue messages as errors if they occurr on items specified as having high priority.

Setting.Name: Report messages as
Setting.Desc: The severity of all messages will be changed to the value specified in this setting. This setting overrides the settings 'Error Messages', 'Warning Messages', 'Informational Messages' and 'Ignore Messages' unless the value is 'Default'.

Setting.Name: Error
Setting.Desc: Force severity to 'Error' for any messages with the same ID as listed in this setting.

Setting.Name: Ignore
Setting.Desc: Ignore any messages with the same ID as listed in this setting.

Setting.Name: Info
Setting.Desc: Force severity to 'Info' for any messages with the same ID as listed in this setting.

Setting.Name: Warning
Setting.Desc: Force severity to 'Warning' for any messages with the same ID as listed in this setting.

Group.Name: Macros
Group.Desc: Settings for macros used by LocVer.

Setting.Name: Macro File
Setting.Desc: Configuration file containing macros for LocVer.

Setting.Name: Skip Parameter Expansion
Setting.Desc: If on, parameters with macros will not be expanded. @ symbols will be interpreted literary.

Group.Name: Language
Group.Desc: Settings specific to the language being processed.

Setting.Name: Behaves Like Lcid
Setting.Desc: If this is set to a culture (other than 'x-neutral'), LocVer will consider the culture specified as being a substitute for the current target language when evaluating language specific rules. The culture will be used unless the current target language has been explicitly stated in an rule.

Setting.Name: Valid Hotkeys
Setting.Desc: List of hotkeys that can be used for this language (case-insensitive).

Group.Name: Processing
Group.Desc: Settings to control which instructions should be processed.

Setting.Name: Exclude Generated Instructions
Setting.Desc: If on, do not process any instructions that have been auto generated (name ends with 'Gen' or the comment is enclosed by '<<' and '>>' or enclosed by <gen> and </gen> tags).

Setting.Name: Only Developer Instructions
Setting.Desc: Only process instructions from source files, i.e. enclosed by <Dev> and </Dev>

Setting.Name: Include Only From Tags
Setting.Desc: Include only instructions within the list of tags.

Setting.Name: Exclude From Tags
Setting.Desc: Exclude any instructions within the list of tags.

Setting.Name: Term Note
Setting.DisplayName: Include Instructions From Term Note Field
Setting.Desc: Include instructions from the term note field.

Setting.Name: Custom Field
Setting.Desc: Specifies a custom field that instructions should be added from. Valid values are 0 to 6. If the value is 0, no instructions are added from a custom field.

Group.Name: Lookup and Namespaces
Group.Desc: Settings for namespace and lookup rules.

Setting.Name: Process lookups and namespaces
Setting.Desc: Should namespace and lookup rules be processed.

Setting.Name: Cached File
Setting.Desc: Path to cache file used for cross-file processing

Group.Name: AutoCommenting
Group.Desc: Use these settings to apply automatic LocVer instructions. Do not change these settings without the help of the LocStudio team.

Group.Name: AutoRule01
Group.Desc: Use these settings to specify an automatic LocVer instruction.

Setting.Name: Description
Setting.Desc: Enter a short description of the automatic instruction.

Setting.Name: Enabled
Setting.Desc: To validate strings according to this automatic instruction, select On. To stop validation with this instruction, select Off.

Setting.Name: RegEx
Setting.Desc: Enter a regular expression to identify information or characters in the string.

Setting.Name: Instruction
Setting.Desc: Enter the instruction that will be automatically applied if all conditions are met. Backreferences from the 'Expression' setting are replaced in the instruction.

Group.Name: Conditions
Group.Desc: Use these settings to specify additional conditions for the automatic LocVer instruction.

Setting.Name: CodePageType
Setting.Desc: Enter the codepage types this instruction will affect. If left blank, all codepages are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: DocumentType
Setting.Desc: Enter the parser IDs this instruction will affect. If left blank, files parsed by any parser are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: FileExtension
Setting.Desc: Enter the file extensions of the file types this instruction will affect. If left blank, all file types are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: Property
Setting.Desc: Enter a name=value pair or a name=~regex pair that requires all items affected by this rule to have the given property name have the value given by the exact match or a value that matches the regular expression (regex)

Setting.Name: Lcid
Setting.Desc: Enter the LCIDs this instruction will affect. If left blank, all LCIDs are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: NumericID
Setting.Desc: Enter a range, minimum to maximum, to match against the numeric part of the item ID contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all numeric item IDs are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: NumericType
Setting.Desc: Enter a range, minimum to maximum, to match against the numeric part of the item type contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all numeric item types are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: StringCategory
Setting.Desc: Enter the string categories this rule will affect. If left blank, all string categories are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: StringID
Setting.Desc: Enter a regular expression to match against the string part of the item ID contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all item IDs are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: StringType
Setting.Desc: Enter a regular expression to match against the string part of the item type contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all item types are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Desc: Enter a short description of the automatic instruction.

Setting.Name: Enabled
Setting.Desc: To validate strings according to this automatic instruction, select On. To stop validation with this instruction, select Off.

Setting.Name: RegEx
Setting.Desc: Enter a regular expression to identify information or characters in the string.

Setting.Name: Instruction
Setting.Desc: Enter the instruction that will be automatically applied if all conditions are met. Backreferences from the 'Expression' setting are replaced in the instruction.

Group.Name: Conditions
Group.Desc: Use these settings to specify additional conditions for the automatic LocVer instruction.

Setting.Name: CodePageType
Setting.Desc: Enter the codepage types this instruction will affect. If left blank, all codepages are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: DocumentType
Setting.Desc: Enter the parser IDs this instruction will affect. If left blank, files parsed by any parser are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: FileExtension
Setting.Desc: Enter the file extensions of the file types this instruction will affect. If left blank, all file types are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: Property
Setting.Desc: Enter a name=value pair or a name=~regex pair that requires all items affected by this rule to have the given property name have the value given by the exact match or a value that matches the regular expression (regex)

Setting.Name: Lcid
Setting.Desc: Enter the LCIDs this instruction will affect. If left blank, all LCIDs are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: NumericID
Setting.Desc: Enter a range, minimum to maximum, to match against the numeric part of the item ID contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all numeric item IDs are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: NumericType
Setting.Desc: Enter a range, minimum to maximum, to match against the numeric part of the item type contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all numeric item types are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: StringCategory
Setting.Desc: Enter the string categories this rule will affect. If left blank, all string categories are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: StringID
Setting.Desc: Enter a regular expression to match against the string part of the item ID contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all item IDs are affected by this instruction.

Setting.Name: StringType
Setting.Desc: Enter a regular expression to match against the string part of the item type contained in the Resource ID. If left blank, all item types are affected by this instruction.
